Material used.Description: Cells were harvested and lysed in lysis buffer (10 mM Tris/HCl, pH 7.8, 100 mM NaCl, 0.5% (w/v) sodium deoxycholate, 0.05% (v/v) nonidet - P40, 10 mM EDTA, 0.1 mM PMSF). Lysates were resolved on 15% polyacrylamide gel (40 mg/lane) and transferred to PVDF membranes (Millipore).

Readout description.Result Description: A 19 kDa a - Syn band was detected in SH - SY5Y cells stably transfected with wt or mutant a - Syn by Western blot analysis. Endogenous a - Syn was not detected in dopaminergic SH - SY5Y cells in this study using the anti - a - Syn antibody clone 7B12.2, but there was weak immunoreactivity in untransfected and mock - transfected cells believed to be endogenous a - Syn due to higher antibody dilution in immunochemistry.

Material used.Description: Cells were seeded onto coverslips and grown to 50%, fixed with 4% (w/v) paraformaldehyde (Sigma - Aldrich) and permeabilized with 0.5% Triton X - 100. Cells were then blocked with 2% goat serum (Sigma - Aldrich), incubated with primary antibody, anti - a - Syn clone 7B12.2 (Chemicon; 1:100 dilution), washed, and incubated with secondary antibody, goat anti - mouse IgG Dylight 488 - conjugated (Thermo Scientific). Coverslips were then mounted on slides.

Readout description.Result Description: Evenly distributed bright fluorescence staining of a - Syn was seen in stably transfected SH - SY5Y cells, while no a - Syn immunoreactivity was shown in untransfected and mock - transfected cells.

Material used.Description: For acute treatment, cells were plated in 96 - well plates at a density of 3 × 10⁴ cells per well. For chronic treatment, cells were fed twice per week with control medium or medium supplemented with 5 nM rotenone or 150 nM maneb, passaged approximately once a week upon reaching confluence for up to 2 weeks, and further subjected to acute oxidative stress of H₂O₂ (15 and 30 mM) for 6 h before MTT assay.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for A30P, A53T, E46K mutants in acute rotenone and maneb treatment; also for A30P and A53T mutants in chronic treatment followed by H₂O₂), Normal (for wt a - Syn in acute rotenone and maneb treatment and in chronic treatment followed by H₂O₂)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss - of - function (for A30P, A53T, E46K mutants), Protective (for wt a - Syn)
Readout description.Result Description: Rotenone and maneb induced SH - SY5Y cell death in a concentration - dependent manner. At 0.50 mM rotenone treatment, wt a - Syn - transfected SH - SY5Y cells had significantly higher cell viability compared to untransfected cells (p < 0.05), while a - Syn mutants had lower cell viability. At 15 mM maneb treatment, wt a - Syn cells had significantly higher cell viability compared to untransfected cells, while mutants had lower viability. After chronic treatment with rotenone or maneb and subsequent H₂O₂ exposure, cells expressing wt a - Syn had significantly greater cell viability compared to untransfected control (p < 0.05), while cell expressing A30P and A53T mutants under chronic maneb treatment had significantly lower cell viability than untransfected control (p < 0.05).

Biological replicates.Description: All data are expressed as means ± S.E.M of 3 independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way - ANOVA. A p value of less than 0.05 was considered as statistically significant.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Measurement of intracellular H₂O₂ level and mitochondrial membrane potential

Material used.Description: Cells were seeded into 6 - well plates at the density of 4 × 10⁵ cells per well and were subjected to acute rotenone or maneb treatments at LC₅₀ concentrations for 48 h, or treated with 15 mM H₂O₂, 6 h after chronic rotenone or maneb treatment. Then cells were stained with 5 mM 2’,7’ - dichlorfluorescein - diacetate (DCFH - DA) or with 40 nM 3,3’ - dihexyloxacarbocyanine iodide (DiOC6(3)), trypsinized, washed twice with cold PBS and resuspended in PBS.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (for A30P, A53T, E46K mutants in terms of ROS generation and mitochondrial membrane potential change), Normal (for wt a - Syn)
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss - of - function (for A30P, A53T, E46K mutants in exacerbating ROS production), Protective (for wt a - Syn in blocking ROS production and preserving mitochondrial membrane potential)
Readout description.Result Description: Compared to control, untreated wt a - Syn cells had significantly lower fluorescence intensity (indicative of lower basal ROS level), while mutants had higher levels. Cells expressing wt a - Syn, but not the mutants, had significant lower ROS than controls after chronic exposure to rotenone and maneb. Also, a reduction in fluorescence of DiOC6(3) was seen following treatment with all the toxic insults, but wt a - Syn, but not mutant variants, preserved the mitochondrial membrane potential.

Biological replicates.Description: All data are expressed as means ± S.E.M of 3 independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way - ANOVA. A p value of less than 0.05 was considered as statistically significant.
